name: Polymer Clay Dragons
description: Polymer Clay Dragon Charms

name: Gold-Spotted Bug Sculpture
description:
A cute bug sculpture made from ceramic, glaze, wire and gold luster.

This lovely little sculpture has an olive colored face with blues and greens on his back. He has little black eyes and a touch of pink glaze inside each ear. The little asteroid he is standing on is an amazing mixture of browns, blues, and green. 

I finished off the sculpture with real gold luster, adding spots to the bug's back and a few golden spots to the asteroid too.

This item is handmade from stoneware clay and is one of a kind.

Size: 2.5 inches tall. The asteroid base is 2 inches wide and 1.75 inches long.

name: Odd Bear Ceramic Sculpture
description:
This ceramic bear wasn't love at first sight. I didn't like him when I first saw him in the raw clay stage. I entertained the idea of smashing him to bits before he ever saw the inside of the kiln. But I kept him, bisque fired him, sat him on my work table and glared at his odd alien appearance for a few weeks more.

I applied some glazes, and let him sit again. Finally, I fired the glazes on this strange bear, and I still did not like him any better. He might have still been a mistake at that point. 

So I threw caution to the wind and decorated him with some gold luster overglaze. It is the most extravagant glaze I own. He went through the kiln for a third and final time.

Somewhere in that final firing, the magic happened. The bear came alive and was finally complete. He has really grown on me now, and I love the way he looks!

He is made from a dark brown clay with white, blue and green speckled glazes applied. The small, bright spots are beads of real silver. His carvings are accented with real gold luster overglaze.

This sculpture is fairly heavy, but when you pick him up, large clay beads roll around inside his hollow body!

Size: 5.5 inches tall, 3.5 inches wide, 9 inches long

name: Green Polymer Clay Beast
description:
Meet Moss! He is a green hairy beastie with freckles. He is a young beastie; older beasts have grown full antlers. Beasties come in every color imaginable, and are named for something they resemble.

Moss is 3.25 inches long, 2 inches wide and 2 inches tall. He is painted with acrylic paint and graphite. Moss is painted in lovely shades of green from dark forest green to a bright green-gold color. He has been varnished with an acrylic matte varnish, except for his eyes and mouth. They have a satin varnish on them to add a little shine.

Beasties love to roam in herds, so be on the lookout for more beasties to collect.

All of my creations are handmade. No two are ever exactly the same!

Moss is signed and dated on the bottom. He is not a toy; he is for display purposes only.

name: Happy Ceramic Monster Family
description:
Monsters have families too! These three ceramic monsters are very happy to be a family. Their bright, shiny eyes are made of real silver!

They are hand-carved from stoneware clay. I started with a ball of clay, then hollowed it out. After it dried partially, I added the legs and spikes one by one. I added a face and cut out the mouth opening so air could escape during the firing.

I used some tools to texture the body and spikes of each monster. After they dried completely, I fired them in my kiln to partially harden the clay. Then I glazed them in some lovely colors. 

The darker spots break a warm brown around the edges of the texture while greens and blues pool in the center. I mixed up a beautiful minty green for the spikes and the rest of the body. Finally the monsters were fired again to a higher temperature to fully mature the clay and glazes.

The large clay monster is 4 inches wide, 4 inches tall, and 4.5 inches long.

The little monsters are 2.5 inches wide and tall. All three are stamped on their bellies with my signature stamp.

I would love for them to be sold as a family, but please contact me if you would like to buy just one.

name: Creature Face Carved Bud Vase
description:
A ceramic bud vase that is just too cute to resist!

This little creature vase is hand-built from stoneware clay and carved with a pattern of lines and spirals all over. He has a plain, burnished clay face and eyes with beads of real silver fired right into the clay!

The outer glaze breaks into a warm brown on the edges of the carvings and streaks of green run inside the carvings. This vase has a very warm, woodland look to it. Inside is a lovely sea-glass green glaze.

This bud vase is 3.5 inches tall and 2.5 inches wide.

Hand wash only please!

name: Three Little Ceramic Pigs
description:
Here are the three little pigs, but their story is up to you!

These little pink pigs are made from stoneware ceramic clay and fired twice in my kiln. You will receive three handmade pigs, each about an inch tall. They will be similar to one another, but as you can see, each one has little quirks and differences.

Your three pigs will come in a reusable metal tin, tied with a striped twine bow and ready for gift giving.

name: Brown Bug Ceramic Sculpture
description:
On a little green asteroid lives a little brown bug. He picks up the silver from the surface of the asteroid and carries it home on his back. After all, even this little brown bug has to make a living!

I made this sculpture from stoneware clay and special hi-temp wire. It is glazed with sea-glass green and a lovely warm brown that is streaked with cream. I added bits of silver to the asteroid and the little bug's back and fired the sculpture to over 2000 degrees in my kiln.

This ceramic sculpture is 1.5 inches wide and 2 inches tall.

name: Handmade Monster Necklace - Red, Green and Blue Ceramic Beads
description:
This happy monster bead is glazed in red with pistachio green speckles. She is flanked by two glossy red beads, and one each of pistachio green and sky blue with brown speckles. The monster is 1.5 inches tall.

All of these beads are handmade and fired to over 2000 degrees in my kiln! The necklace is strung with a black, waxed cotton cord that is 24 inches long. The length can be adjusted to a smaller size using the sliding knots that tie the necklace together.

The cotton cord becomes softer with each use, making for a very comfortable necklace to wear. You can also remove it if you want to use the beads for one of your own art projects.

name: Ceramic Monster Necklace - Raspberries and Cream
description:
Handmade ceramic beads make this a fun and whimsical necklace.

Two deep purple beads and two cream colored beads with brown spots frame a happy monster focal bead. She is glazed in lovely cream and raspberry glazes. Her eyes have beads of real silver in them too!

The monster is 1.5 inches tall and the black, waxed cotton cord necklace has a maximum length of 24 inches. You can make it shorter using the adjustable sliding knots that tie the necklace together.

name: Gold, Brown and Blue Creature Sculpture
description:
This little creature is not quite sure what he is, and no one else knows either! He would still love for someone to give him a home.

I sculpted this ceramic figurine from stoneware clay and glazed him in a warm sandy brown. The indentation on his back has lovely blue glass melted in it. The glass has cracks that run beneath the surface giving it a sparkly, jewel-like effect.

Finally, I added details in real gold luster to make this creature a spectacular little sculpture.

Size: 3 inches long, 2 inches tall, and 1.25 inches wide.

name: Monster Ceramic Necklace - Green and Gold
description:
This ceramic necklace has a focal bead decorated in beautiful swirled greens with little gold antlers. The monster has a white face accented with black underglaze. His shiny bright eyes are made of real silver!

Two matching gold beads and two brown beads with blue and grey swirls frame the monster on either side. This is a lovely handmade necklace that is one of a kind!

The monster bead is 1.75 inches tall. The beads are strung on a black, waxed cotton cord. The necklace has a length of 24 inches that can be made smaller using the adjustable sliding knots.

name: Monster Faces Ceramic Bowl
description:
This unique monster bowl is handmade from stoneware clay and has seven different monster faces circling the outside. The glaze varies with shades of red, yellow, gray and black all swirling together. You can see a lot of red on the inside of the bowl.

The faces are white clay with black underglaze details and a clear gloss sealing the clay.

This would make an excellent candy dish, or even a place to toss your spare change. All the glazes are food safe.

Size: 3 inches tall, 6 inches across.

name: Ceramic Monster Necklace - White and Cinnamon
description:
Chunky bead monster necklace in white, cinnamon and brown.

Each of the five beads on this necklace is handmade. Two brown beads with cream streaks and two speckled cinnamon pink beads frame an adorable monster bead. The little monster is glazed in a creamy white with pink speckles and spots.

Her face is an unglazed white clay with real silver to give her bright, shiny eyes.

The monster is 1.5 inches tall. The beads are strung on a black, waxed cotton cord. It has a maximum length of 24 inches that can be made smaller using the adjustable, sliding knots that tie the necklace together.

name: Color Your Own Stickers - Set 1
description:
You get 12 monster stickers to color and stick anywhere. The sticker paper they are printed on is super sticky and they have stuck to everything I've tried so far!

These stickers are printed from my original designs on a matte crack and peel label stock. Each one is cut out by hand and ready for you to color and use. Gray dots on the back liner indicate a seam where it can easily be peeled away from the sticker.

Markers, colored pencils, gel pens and even light coats of acrylic paint work great to color these stickers!

The smallest is 1 inch by 1.25 inches. The largest is 3.5 x 3.5 inches.

Each set comes in a clear plastic bag with handmade labeling.

Please see the second photo to see all the sticker designs you will receive.

name: Three Surprise Ceramic Cats
description:
Adorable ceramic kitties are waiting to surprise you! Each one is handmade without the use of any molds, so every cat is different! They come in an endless variety of colors and patterns. New cats are made every week!

Three are chosen at random and gift wrapped in a reusable metal tin.

There's just one problem... you can never have enough of them!

Every cat is handmade of stoneware or porcelain clay. After they dry, they are bisque-fired, glazed and finally fired a final time to over 2000 degrees in my kiln.

They range in size from an inch tall to a little over 1.5 inches.

These are for display only and not for children.

name: White and Moss Dragon Beast Sculpture
description:
Age has made this tall forest dragon powerful but slow. She moves so slow that the moss grows on her body. Blue green flowers grow amongst the moss. Her skin has grown white with age and shimmering spots of bronze mar her with imperfections. Her antlers have turned the same lovely shade of bronze and a vine of great, shimmering leaves decorates them like jewels on a crown. She has one foot poised in the air, ready to take a step.

These dragons can be found protecting the ancient, old-growth forests.

***********************************

This clay dragon made of durable, air-drying stone clay sculpted over a wire armature. Every last bit of this sculpture was created by hand without the use of any molds. The craters on her back were added one at a time. The leaves adorning her antlers are made of polymer clay, each carefully sculpted and painted by hand. The moss is sculpted and textured with a small, fine brush. The chain in her antlers has been glued in place to make it a permanent part of the sculpture.

*********************************

These dragon beasts are my favorites to make, but due to their time-consuming process to make them, they are very limited in number.

I used artist grade acrylics to paint her with, in white, shimmering bronze and several shades of green. She is antiqued with sepia-tinted graphite paint and sealed with several layers of acrylic varnish. Her eyes have an extra layer of satin varnish for extra shine!

This clay sculpture is signed and dated on the bottom of one foot.

This beast is 7.5 inches tall, 7.25 inches long, and 5 inches wide at the tips of her antlers. The leaves range from about half an inch to an inch long.

name: Calico Cat Sculpture
description:
This ceramic calico cat has a very sweet face.

She is handmade from stoneware clay and stamped all over with my handmade star stamp. Her glaze colors are creamy white, mottled brown, and a lovely black that varies from black to grey and even red in some very small spots.

She is 3 inches tall, just over 2 inches wide, and 2.5 inches long.

This cat is hollow and stamped with my personal signature stamp.

name: Ceramic Dragon Figurine
description:
This ceramic dragon figurine is sleeping the day away.

I glazed him in a warm textured brown and a dark gold. He has a row of spots running down his back and tail.

I left his face unglazed for contrast and accented the details with a black underglaze.

This dragon is handmade and one of a kind!

Size: 2 inches tall and wide, 2.5 inches long.

name: Yellow Clay Monster
description:
Yellow Clay Monster Figurine with Silver Stripes.

Size: 3.25 inches long, 2.75 inches tall, and 2 inches wide at the tips of his horns.

This sleepy yellow monster figurine is hand-sculpted from air-drying clay and painted with artist quality acrylics in shades of lemony yellow. His stripes are painted a dark silver that shimmers in the light. The entire creature is antiqued with a dark acrylic paint and sealed with several layers of matte varnish for protection.

He is very lightweight, but still strong and well made.

Lemony would love to live in your home! (He's very well behaved and spends all his time sleeping.)

name: Surprise Ceramic Owls
description:
Surprise owls are waiting for you!

You may choose three or five owls, already wrapped for gift giving to someone special or just a treat for yourself.

Your owls are randomly chosen from my current stock, but each one is handmade and adorable.

They range from half an inch tall to just under two inches tall. No molds are used to make them, so each one is unique. The combinations of colors and patterns is endless!

These owls would also be great as terrarium decorations!

My owls are made from stoneware clay and fired in my kiln to a final temperature of over 2000 degrees.

These owls are for decoration only. They are not toys and should not be given to children.

name: Three Surprise Ceramic Monsters
description:
Get three unique ceramic monsters! None of them are ever the same. Each creepy cute monster is made by hand and no molds are ever used. Some even have eyes made of real silver!

Your monsters will be chosen at random, carefully wrapped in tissue paper, and placed in a metal tin that you can reuse once your monsters are set free. I'll add a bow and mail them to you. The ones you receive will be a surprise, and may not be the monsters shown in the photos.

They range in size from about an inch tall to just under two inches tall.

They come in a variety of colors, shapes and sizes. Some have horns or spikes, some monsters have tails, and others wear mischievous grins.

My monsters are made from porcelain and stoneware and fired in my kiln to a final temperature of over 2000 degrees.

These little monsters are for decoration only. They are not toys and should not be given to children.

name: Owlasaurus Ceramic Owl Dinosaur Sculpture
description:
Behold the mighty Owlasaurus (or Owlosaurus if you prefer).

The Owlasaurus is a small but fierce creature that prefers to ignore humans. Which is very fortunate for us as they have short tempers and like to bite. They are rather plump and don't fly very well.

This particular Owlasaurus is a lovely shade of mossy green and creamy white with metallic gold details.

He is 2 inches tall, 2.25 inches long and 1 inch wide. He is made of stoneware clay, glazed and fired to over 2000 degrees in my kiln. You won't find another just like him.

The rock in the photo is not included in this sale.
